questions.question: When would you choose AWS App Mesh over AWS Application Load Balancer for managing traffic between microservices?
options: When you need advanced service-to-service communication features like retries, circuit breakers, and distributed tracing across multiple services
When you only need to distribute traffic between multiple instances of a single service
When you want to reduce infrastructure costs by eliminating the need for proxies
When you need to handle traffic from external users to your application
questions.explanation: App Mesh provides advanced service mesh capabilities including retries, circuit breakers, observability, and traffic management between services, while ALB is primarily for load balancing external traffic to services.

questions.question: What is the primary role of Envoy proxy sidecars in AWS App Mesh architecture?
options: To replace the need for service discovery mechanisms
To intercept and manage all network traffic between services while implementing mesh policies
To store application data and provide caching capabilities
To serve as the primary application runtime environment
questions.explanation: Envoy sidecars act as intelligent proxies that intercept service-to-service communication and enforce mesh policies like routing, retries, circuit breaking, and observability without requiring application code changes.

questions.question: Which scenario best illustrates when to implement circuit breakers in a service mesh?
options: When you need to encrypt all traffic between services
When a downstream service is experiencing failures and you want to prevent cascading failures by temporarily stopping requests to it
When you want to distribute traffic evenly across multiple service instances
When you need to authenticate requests between services
questions.explanation: Circuit breakers monitor service health and temporarily block requests to failing services to prevent cascading failures and allow time for recovery, improving overall system resilience.

questions.question: How does AWS Lattice differ from AWS App Mesh in terms of service mesh implementation?
options: Lattice requires manual installation of sidecar proxies while App Mesh is serverless
Lattice provides application-layer service networking without requiring sidecar proxies, while App Mesh uses Envoy sidecars
Lattice only works with Lambda functions while App Mesh works with containers
Lattice is designed for monolithic applications while App Mesh is for microservices
questions.explanation: AWS Lattice provides service-to-service connectivity and traffic management without requiring sidecar proxies, operating at the VPC level, while App Mesh uses Envoy sidecars for traffic interception and management.

questions.question: In a microservices architecture experiencing intermittent network issues, what combination of service mesh features would best improve reliability?
options: Load balancing and SSL termination only
Service discovery and API gateway integration
Automatic retries with exponential backoff and circuit breakers to handle transient failures and service degradation
Container orchestration and auto-scaling policies
questions.explanation: Retries with exponential backoff handle transient network issues by automatically retrying failed requests, while circuit breakers prevent overwhelming degraded services, together providing comprehensive resilience against intermittent failures.
